intro: Dichapetalum gagnepainii, commonly known as the Gagnepain's mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions of South Africa and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
